name: Baseos
tagline: USB based OS featuring selective data permanence and block level encryption
body:
### baseOS
baseOS is a framework for generating USB operating systems with selective data permanence and block level user encryption. Deploy custom operating systems to employees or students to access company resources in a BYOD setting.

### Features
* Runs mostly on ram reducing I/O hits from running off slow media.
* Boots up cleanly from an encrypted user image and a read only root. Test out new programs on baseOS without committing anything to disk!
* Based on Arch Linux and features the pacman package manager.
* Block level encryption of user img allows deploying multiplying multiple baseOS imgs with minor user changes.
* Comes with tor, openvpn, and socks support.


### Minimum Requirements:
* 1GB Ram
* 2GB USB/HDD/SSD/SD
* Keyboard support

### Support or Contact
Contact mark@markelee.com about customizing and deploying baseOS for your business or school.
